section.name: Downloading and installing JStyx
section.p: The process of installing the JStyx software (which includes the Styx Grid Services software) is very simple.

subsection.name: Set up Java
subsection.p: JStyx is a set of Java classes and so we need a Java runtime environment to run the software:

ol.li: Download and install a Java runtime environment version 1.4.2 or above from here.
Add the bin directory of the Java installation to your PATH environment variable.

Test this by opening a new terminal window or command prompt and typing java -version. The version number of the Java installation should be printed to the console. This should work from any directory on your system.
Unzip the distribution into the directory of your choice.
Set the environment variable JSTYX_HOME to the location of this directory.
Add the JSTYX_HOME/bin directory to your PATH environment variable.

Test the installation by opening a new terminal window or command prompt and typing SGSRun with no arguments. You should see the usage message Usage: SGSRun <hostname> <port> <servicename>. This should work from any directory on your system. If you see an error message you probably haven't set your environment varibles correctly.
